Glyph Handbook

Here you can find the meanings of the glyphs of the ancient language, alongside a breakdown of their visual meaning and the reasons we believe they mean what they mean. For some glyphs, we aren't sure what the meaning is yet and they are marked as X.

Glyph Number Glyph Meaning Breakdown Reasoning
#001

!

 Goddess Glyph #056 but with nubs at its base which suggest femininity, as seen in #008.
#002

"

 Thorns
Tentative 		Wall 35 defines this symbol as being equal to spike (#029) plant (#020).
#003

#

 Metal Wall 3 (L1) list blades, spikes, and the crushing trap as being traps (#28) made of this glyph. It can be infered as "metal." Wall 1 (L1) tells us that this glyph and light (#024) create what can be interpreted as a glint or shine (#009). Wall 57 (L1) can be interpreted as hot (#240) metal and cold (#241) water (#053) making a blade (#021), decribing the forging process.
#004

$

 Fire Symbol used for the Fire Whip. Wall 1 (L2) suggests that stone (#187) and metal (#003) together make the smalles (#013) version of this glyph. Can be interpreted as a spark. Wall 6 (L2) suggest that this glyph and plant matter (#020) make ash (#023). Wall 13 (L3) suggest that this glyph and water (#053) are opposites (#058).
#005

%

 Abyss Void under hill >>> A vast empry space that is underground = Abyss Curved line: Place of Spiral: Void Symbol used for the Void Whip and in the game's logo. Appears on the head of Bodach/Altec God of Abyss.
#006

&

 Faith
Tentative 		Diamond: Emotion of Circle/3 dots: Similar to worship (87), opposite?
#007

'

 King
Tentative 		Square-dot-line: Person Line at bottom: Important Curved line ends: male Wall 52 suggests a feudal hierarchy and denotes #007 and #008 as being the highest quality, equal to that of #224.
#008

(

 Queen Square-dot-line: Person Line at bottom: Important Dot line ends: Female See #007 Hub 3 suggests that #007 and #008 made many children, with which we can infer that they must be of opposite gender to make children.
#009

)

 Gold
Tentative 		If line were passing through circle and two more lines emerge, it is likely shining/reflective/gleaming Appears on gold coins. Variations of this symbol are used to suggest Wealth, Greed and Generousity. This symbol also appears in conjunction with #011, possibly referring to El Dorado, The City of Gold.
#010

*

 Silver
Tentative 		If line was line of sight, it's passing around circle without seeing it, likely hidden/concealed/unseen Counterpart to #009 This symbol is used to describe clouds on Wall 55, it could be referring to the colour of the clouds. A silver sky.
#011

+

 City/Civilization Wall 5 suggests that this glyph is equal to many buildings (#036).
#012

,

 Less
Tentative 		Wall 9 (L1) portrays this symbol with numbers saying "2 is __ than 1, 1 is __ than 2"; interpreted as more and less respectively.
#013

-

 Least
Tentative 		Wall 9 (L2) defines this as "__ is less than less."; interpreted as "the least is smaller than small"
#014

.

 not
Tentative 		The lines do not touch Appears together with Whip (#182) glyph on a surface that cannot be whipped. Often used to negate verbes in sentences .
#015

/

 Have/Possess
Tentative 		In contexts with emotions it can be interpreted as having an emotion instead of "being" an emotion. Every other contex it appears works well with the idea of having or possessing
#016

<

 Great/Big/More
Tentative 		See #012
#017

=

 Greatest/Most
Tentative 		Wall 9 (L2) defines this as "__ more than more."; interpreted as "most is more than more"
#018

>

 but
Tentative 		And, inverted This symbol is used often to provide a negative context to a prior expression.
#019

?

 Create
Tentative 		As reading left to right, this means it speaks of the thing splintering into two Often used in contexts where 2 or more items cometogether to make one, or when a person is producing something.
#020

@

 Plant
Tentative 		It looks like a plant. It's similar to the symbol for Vine (#230). Wall 24 explains that in order for this symbol to grow, it requires Light (#024) and Water (#053). Wall 6 says this symbol and Fire (#004) make Ash (#023).
#021

A

 Blade/Sword
Tentative 		Cursed symbol reflected vertically This symbol appears by all spinning blade traps. It also appears on an Inferno Relic shaped as a sword.
#022

B

 Person
Tentative 		The dot in the middle often comes with sentient things, suggesting this has sentience. The shape can be interpreted as a body with a dead. other than that, the meaning person/human works in every contexts it is found it.
#023

C

 Ash/soot
Tentative 		Wall 6 appears to say that a Plant (#020) met with Fire (#004) becomes this. Hub 24 suggests that the City (#011) became Ruins (#057) and what's presented here.
#024

D

 Light
Tentative 		Lines emanate from circle Wall 55 (L2) defines this as being given by the Sun (#233). Wall 24 (L1) suggest that plants (#020) need this and water (#053) to grow (#146).
#025

E

 Darkness
Tentative 		Line does not pass into circle Wall 55 defines this as being given by the Moon (#234) and Stars (#235). Wall 13 (L1) states that this glyph and light (#024) are opposites (#058). Wall 14 (L2) states that this glyph is not light (#024). The caverns glyph has the same particle (arc) as this glyph
#026

F

 Birth
Tentative 		Create + dot + become Wall 14 (L3) states that death (#027) is not this glyph Wall 8 states that all (#13) people (#022) are born and all people die (#027)
#027

G

 Death
Tentative 		Void + dot See entry #026 Once established as death it works in all instances it shows up Is a radical in the glyphs for sacrifice (#094) and kill (#216)
#028

H

 Danger/Trap
Tentative 		Seen on traps in temples Wall 44 (L2) States that a safe (#258) room (#034) has none (#156) of these Wall 3 (L1) States blades (#021), spikes (#029), and crushers (#030) are metal (#003) these Wall 3 (L2) State boulders (#135), rolling pins (#150), and pitfalls (#186) are stone these
#029

I

 Spike
Tentative 		Seen on spike traps in temples
#030

J

 Crushing Stone
Tentative 		This symbol is within itself Seen on crushing traps in temples Symbol for the crushing stone that falls from above. When you die from it, the death screen says that you were "crushed."
#031

M

 Left
Tentative 		Looks like left and right arrows In contrast to up (#047) and down (#048) arrows on Wall 4 (L2)
#032

N

 Right
Tentative 		Looks like left and right arrows In contrast to up (#047) and down (#048) arrows on Wall 4 (L2)
#033

O

 Choose
Tentative 		Three horizontal lines: or Diamond brackets: exclusive? Seen between to choices at the blessing statue
#034

P

 Room
Tentative 		Floor symbol below, above, and two the sides Wal 5 (L1) state that a few (#037) of these make a floor (#035). Wall 61 (L1) state that a ceiling (#228), a floor (#229), and four (#160) walls (#221) makes one of these.
#035

Q

 Floor (of a building)
Tentative 		Floor symbol below and above, but multiple spaces between Wall 5 (L1) states that this is made of a few (#037) rooms (#034) Wall 5 (L1) states that a few of these makes a building (#036)
#036

R

 Building
Tentative 		Wall 5 (L1) states that a few (#037) floors (#035) make this Wall 5 (L2) states that a few of these makes a town (#189) but many (#038) of these makes a kingdom (#011)
#037

S

 Some
Tentative 		Has less vertical line than "many" (#038) but more than "few" (#086) works in all contexts
#038

T

 Many
Tentative 		Has more vertical lines than both "some" (#037) and "few" (#086)
#039

U

 Time
Tentative 		There is not concrete eveidence for this being time. Time just seems to be what we have found fits the best in the sentences where its found.
#040

V

 Past
Tentative
#041

W

 Present
Tentative
#042

X

 Future
Tentative
#043

Y

 Year
Tentative 		Alt use underlines numbers, likely date/time Wall 21 (L1) states that a child (#059) with few (#086) of these is young (#084) Wall 21 (L3) states that a person (#022) with many (#038) of these is old (#085)
#044

Z

 You
Tentative 		Square-dot-with-line: Person Additional lines: Targeted? Seen on ingame map showing your current location in the temple
#045

[

 Coin/Money
Tentative 		Square: Metal (square?)-4-lines: Valuable Appears on the door which you can pay 100 coins for in order to bypass sections of a level. Wall 12 (L1) states that a generous (#065) person (#022) gives (#069) this to a poor (#071) person Wall 17 (L1) states that a greedy (#107) person wants (#064) all (#134) of this Wall 17 (L1) states that a wealthy (#051) person has (#015) a lot of this
#046

]

 Peace
Tentative 		Found as part of the calm blessing from statues Wall 11 (L1) sates that a person (#022) of this has no (#156) blade (#021) Wall 15 (L1) states that violence (#079) is not (#014) this
#047

^

 Rise/Up/High
Tentative 		Its usually only used in connection with other Symbols, making this a modifier symbol for meaning "up"
#048

_

 Fall/Down/Low
Tentative 		Its usually only used in connection with other Symbols, making this a modifier symbol for meaning "down"
#049

`

 Rule(r)
Tentative 		Wall 10 (L3) states that a king (#007) does this over many (#112) citizens (038) Wall 43 (L1) states that oppression (#066) is to do this with fear (#108)
#050

a

 Meet
Tentative 		Offer dot, inverse-offer-dot. Exchange? There is not concrete eveidence for this one other than the fact that "meet" tends to work pretty well in all of its contexts
#051

b

 Wealth
Tentative 		Circle-4-lines: Valuable Valable-valuable-valuable Wall 17 (L2) states that this kind of person (#022) has (#015) a lot of (#38) money (#045) Wall 28 (L1) states that money attracts (#145) a person who wants (#64) this
#052

c

 Beauty
Tentative 		Wall 3 the most/greates of this glyph is considered to be a trap fo the body and spirit. it being beauty could sugges that the shallowness of chasing extreme beauty is nothing more than a trap. Wall 11 it could be suggested that a beautiful person has no body flaws. Wall 25 can be interpreted as saying someone who gathers beauty will atract others Wall 28 this glyph "attracts people who want love". Hub 3 if this glyph indeed means beauty, then it wouldnt be strange to suggest the king met with the "beautiful" queen These reasons incule EVERY instance the glyph is used It also looks like #153 but with lines, similar to how "shiny/gold" is "light"#009 with lines, etc. Symbol combines "look/see" #153 with "shiny/gold" #009 Could be interpreted as "something that makes your eyes shine"
#053

d

 Rain/Water
Tentative 		The glyph looks like falling rain. In Wall 13 it is said to be the opposite of fire. In Wall 24 it is required, alongside light, for plants to grow. In Wall 54 is its required alongside the sun for plants to grow.
#054

e

 Ocean/Sea
Tentative 		Wall 35 (L1) defines this as a lot of water The glyph looks like waves.
#055

f

 Chasm
Tentative 		Appears in Wall 35 as (#103) down many, and next to "thorns" and "river". Looks like a chasm.
#056

g

 God(s)
Tentative 		Curved line: Place Square-dot: Being Square-atop-line: Being above/superior to place? The Statue in the Middle (Bodach) introduces himself as "God of the Abyss" and his this symbol on his Belt. Also what we know from the hub story writings to far, this checks out with the Title that uses this Symbol combined with the Symbol for "Abyss". This symbol is ungendered.
#057

h

 Ruins
Tentative 		The Symbol is being used for the first section of the Temple in the Temple Map. The first section of the Temple are basically ruins. (Outside of the game, one of the Devs called this section "Ruins") The game files also reference this area as the "Ruins Area")
#058

i

 Opposites
Tentative 		Wall 13 lists things that are opposites using this
#059

j

 Child
Tentative 		Dot-square with downward line: Person Incomplete square Wall 2 (L1) states that two people inlove will make many of these Wall 31 (L1) defines grand child as being this of this
#060

k

 Happy
Tentative 		Diamond: Emotion of Shining/Golden Wall 11 (L3) stats that this kind of person has no flaws in their soul Wall 18 (L3) defines ecstasy as being the most extreme this this interpretation works very well everywhere it is used
#061

l

 Walk/Move
Tentative 		Brackets: Exclusive? Arrows: Left/Right? Possible: shift Wall 45 (L1) states that crawling is how the youngest child does this Wall 56 (L1) states that a stone does this downward in water
#062

m

 Unchanged/Still
Tentative 		Inverted brackets: No choice Wall 22 (L2) states that the death of a person is when a body is this
#063

n

 Path/Cross
Tentative 		The hubs suggest that the gods crossed an ocean to reach the city using this glyph Wall 62 uses this to talk about connecting rooms together via halls and shafts (interpret this as "to make a path" through something) Wall 44 (L3) states that surviving is to fo this to a dangerous room and live
#064

p

 Desire
Tentative 		Diamond: Emotion of Create-turned-sideways The hubs use this glyph to talk about how the king wanted immortality this definition works very well in every context it is found
#065

q

 Generous
Tentative 		Diamond: Emotion of L bar: Offer Circle-4-lines: Valuable Wall 12 (L1) states that this kind of person gives money to the poor.
#066

r

 Oppression
Tentative 		Wall 15 (L5) states that this is anti freedom Wall 43 (L1) states that to do this is to rule with fear
#067

s

 Blessing
Tentative 		L bar: Offer Light [to give] blessing Symbol appears as a particle when recieving a blessing
#068

t

 Punish
Tentative 		Reverse L bar: Forcibly offer? Dark Wall 39 (L4) states that an angry god does this to selfish people
#069

u

 Exchange/Trade
Tentative 		L bar: Offer Reverse/Flipped L bar: Receive offer? Circle-4-lines: Valuable Similar to how we assume that #070 features a hand, let's assume that there are two hands (top & bottom) in this glyph, each symbolising a party. With this, we can infer that this is a mutually-agreed trade.
#070

v

 Selfish
Tentative 		Diamond: Emotion of L bar: Offer Pyramid dash: Ash/Dust Wall 17 (L4) states that this kind of person doesnt give any money Wall 12 (L2) states that this kind of person doesn't give money to the poor
#071

w

 Poor
Tentative 		Dust/Dust/Dust? Wall 17 (L3) states that this kind of person recieves little money Walln 12 (L1) states that a generous person gives money to this kind of person
#072

x

 Confident
Tentative 		Diamond: Emotion of Left/right, but rotated: Opposite shift? Bravery? As of right now, any one of the meanings presented here can fit eaqually as nice into the translations
#073

y

 Sad
Tentative 		Diamond: Emotion of Water drop/Water drop: Tears? Wall 15 (L3) states that this is anti happiness
#074

z

 Sorrow
Tentative 		Diamond: Emotion of Triple line/drop: Water Breaching diamond: Overwhelming emotion Wall 18 (L1) states that this is extreme sadness In Hub 25, the queen became this way after her son never returned from the temple
#075

{

 Anger
Tentative 		Diamond: Emotion of Cursed+flipped: Weapon Wall 2 (L2) states that two people and this make violence Wall 18 (L2) states that rage is an extreme version of this Wall 39 (L4) states that this kind of god punnishes selfish people
#076

|

 Love
Tentative 		Diamond: Emotion of Circle/Circle/Line: ?? Wall 2 (L1) states that two people and this will make many children Wall 15(L2) states that this is the antithesis to hate Wall 28 (L2) states that beauty attracts those who want this
#077

}

 Hate
Tentative 		Diamond: Emotion of Split/no touch: Not Wall 15 (L2) states that this is anti love
#078

~

 Crazy/Confused
Tentative 		Diamond: Emotion of Spiral: Void Wall 29 (L4) states that this kind of person wears shoes on their head
#079

Volence/Conflict
Tentative 		Curved line: Place 5 vertical lines: Rage/spikes? Wall 15 (L1) states that this is not peace Wall 2 (L2) states that two people and anger make this I would like to make a further argument against this being war. First reason is that while war is indeed not peace, voilence or conflict of any kind is also not peace. The second reason this is not war is becasue war requires more than two people
#080

Wise
Tentative 		Wall 21 (L4) states that an old person has this Wall 39 (L1) states that this kind of person gives money to the gods
#081

Naivety
Tentative 		Wall 21 (L2) states that a young child is this
#082

Grandchild
Tentative 		Wall 31(L1) defines this as being the children of children
#083

Great Grandchild
Tentative 		Wall 31 (L2) defines this as being the children of grandchildren
#084

Young
Tentative 		Wall 21 (L1) states that a child with few years is this Wall 21 (L2) states that this kind of child is naive Wall 45 (L1) states that crawling is the movement of this kind of child
#085

Old
Tentative 		Wall 21 (L4) states that a person with many years is this Wall 21 (L4) states that this kind of person has wisdom Wall 30 (L2) states that this kind of person is afraid of death
#086

Few
Tentative 		Wall 17 (L3) states that poor people recieve this many coins It is similar in structure but smaller than the glyphs "some" and "many"
#087

Worship
Tentative 		Wall 32 (L1) states that a temple is a building where this happens Hub 7 (L4) says that many citizens did this to the gods
#088

Accordance/Agree/Agreement
Tentative 		Diamond: Emotion of Symbol inside: (62-Unchanging) Implacable? The first last line of Hub 7 and first line of Hub 8 can suggest that the king "agreed" to worship the gods and as a concequence built the temples. In Hub 21 the king wants the prince to enter the temple for him. Hub 22 then could be read as the prince agreenig to enter. Wall 15 gives the oposite of this symbol. If interpreted as them meaning "discord/chaos" and accordance/agree/order" then discordant works well for the other symbol in multiple contexts.
#089

Temple
Tentative 		Wall 32 defines this as a building of worship.
#090

Request
Tentative 		This shows up in every hub when the king is asking the gods for an answer as to what to do.
#091

Again/Still
Tentative 		It only shows up on things which have happened before.
#092

Demand
Tentative 		Wall 36 (L2) states that this is to request forcefully
#093

Require
Tentative 		Wall 24 (L1) can be read as growing plants "require" light and water Often used in the hubs to suggest that the gods "require" sacrifices
#094

Sacrifice
Tentative 		L bar: offer Second symbol: Death Many hubs suggest that the gods need this and that receive it by having the king lure people into the temple to die. Has the glyph for death ontop of a hand suggesting "giving death"
#095

Release/Free
Tentative 		Shows up in game when your phantom has been released
#096

Phantom/spirit/soul
Tentative 		Can be seen on the Phantom Abyss Logo
#097

Enter
Tentative 		Can be seen on temple doors saying "enter key into door" Wall 14 (L1) defines this as not being exit Wall 22 (L2) states that the birth of a person is when the body is moving and the soul does this
#098

Exit
Tentative 		Wall 14 (L1) defines this as not being enter Wall 22 (L2) states that the death of a person is when the body is still and the soul does this
#099

Body
Tentative 		Wall 29 (L1) states that a head is the highest part of this Wall 29 (L2) states that the foot is the lowest part of this
#100

Never
Tentative 		Wall 16 (L1) Defines this as not being the past, presesnt or furture Wall 34 (L1) can be interpreted as saying immortality is to "never" die
#101

Broken/flaw
Tentative 		Wall 38 (L2) states that ruins is when everything is this. Wall 11 (L2) states that beauty is when the body has none of this
#102

Head
Tentative 		Wall 29 (L1) states that this is the highest part of the body
#103

Fall/Drop
Tentative 		Appears only in Wall 35, next to "down" "many", Similar (but not the same) as the gylph on the chasm trapdoor trap, and the air bouncer trap. However, weird it isn't used as "fall" in the Wall 56 where "move" "down" is used instead.
#104

In order to
Tentative 		In Hub(s) 9, 19 & 23, this glyph can be interpreted to suggest an event happens for a result to come about

Tentative

pain/torture
Tentative 		Cursed reflected vertically, with <-> in the middle, perhaps middle symbol similar to grow? Hub 24 (L4) can be read as the king forcing the citizens into choosing between entering the temple and being tortured Wall 34 (L3) states that ___ wants to grow old and have a "painless" death Wall 43 (L3) states that this glyph is violence and surviving (torture is to endure violence?)

0

#159
